  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Community Lead",
  "description": "CcHUB is Nigeria&rsquo;s first open living lab and pre-incubation space being designed to be a multi-functional, multi-purpose space where work to catalyze creative social tech ventures take place. The HUB is a place for technologists, social entrepreneurs, government, tech companies, impact investors and hackers in and around Lagos to co-create new solutions to the many social problems in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Community Lead

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (On-site)

Job Purpose


	The Community Lead will provide strategic direction and oversight for the GATEWAY Program&rsquo;s community management efforts across multiple states in Nigeria.
	The role will focus on creating and sustaining a thriving community ecosystem that enables marginalized youth, women, and vulnerable groups to engage actively, access resources, and transition into meaningful learning and work opportunities.
	The Community Lead will design and implement the overall community engagement strategy, build strong linkages with hubs, gig platforms, and ecosystem partners, and ensure the program&rsquo;s communities are inclusive, accessible, and impactful.
	The Lead will manage and mentor Community Managers and Learning Community Coordinators, ensuring consistency, innovation, and quality in delivery across all states.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Community Building and Engagement:


	Design and oversee the implementation of the GATEWAY Program&rsquo;s community management strategy across hubs, digital platforms, and physical engagement spaces.
	Cultivate vibrant, inclusive communities that foster belonging, collaboration, and peer-to-peer learning.
	Oversee both online and offline engagement models, ensuring consistency, scalability, and innovation across states.
	Provide strategic direction for community-led events, peer-learning forums, and engagement campaigns, ensuring alignment with program objectives.


Participant Support and Pathways:


	Ensure participants have access to timely, effective support through well-coordinated escalation systems.
	Strengthen pathways linking participants to training, gig platforms, financial services, and mentorship opportunities.
	Provide leadership to resolve systemic participant challenges by analyzing recurring issues and coordinating program-level improvements.


Ecosystem Partnerships and Stakeholder Engagement


	Represent the community function in high-level stakeholder forums, ensuring participant voices shape program strategy and delivery.
	Drive collaboration with local organizations to deepen grassroots reach and inclusion.


Monitoring, Learning, and Reporting:


	Establish frameworks for measuring community growth, engagement, inclusivity, and impact across states.
	Guide the collection and analysis of participant feedback to inform continuous improvement.
	Ensure success stories, case studies, and community insights are systematically documented and shared with program leadership and donors.


Leadership, Mentorship, and Inclusion:


	Lead, mentor, and build the capacity of Community Managers and Learning Community Coordinators to deliver consistently across all states.
	Promote equity and accessibility in community initiatives, ensuring marginalized groups (young women, PWDs, displaced youth) are effectively reached.
	Model inclusive leadership and build a culture of trust, accountability, and continuous learning within the community team.


Key Performance Indicators


	Strategic Community Building and Engagement
	Participant Support and Pathways
	Ecosystem Partnerships and Stakeholder Engagement
	Monitoring, Learning, and Reporting
	Leadership, Mentorship, and Inclusion


Qualifications
Education:


	
	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Social Sciences, Communications, Community Development, or a related field (Master&rsquo;s preferred).
	


Experience:


	8&ndash;10 years of progressive experience in community leadership, youth mobilization, or large-scale engagement programs.
	Proven experience designing and implementing multi-state or multi-country community strategies.
	Track record of managing senior community managers, engagement officers, or volunteers.
	Demonstrated experience working with marginalized populations, particularly youth and women, and building inclusive ecosystems.


Skills and Competencies:


	Strong leadership and people management skills with experience coaching and mentoring teams.
	Advanced strategic planning and execution skills in community development.
	Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and stakeholder management abilities.
	Strong understanding of digital engagement tools, social platforms, and community analytics.
	Ability to design inclusive, scalable, and data-driven community engagement models.
	Skilled in conflict resolution, trust-building, and ecosystem partnership development.
	Analytical mindset with the ability to translate data into actionable insights for program improvement.


Note


	Please note this is an onsite role in Lagos, Nigeria
	Co-creation HUB (CcHUB) is an equal opportunity employer.
	The Company prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
	The Company conforms to the spirit as well as to the letter of all applicable laws and regulations.

Community Lead Job at Co Creation Hub




        
    

        
        CcHUB is Nigeria’s first open living lab and pre-incubation space being designed to be a multi-functional, multi-purpose space where work to catalyze creative social tech ventures take place. The HUB is a place for technologists, social entrepreneurs, government, tech companies, impact investors and hackers in and around Lagos to co-create new solutions to the many social problems in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Community Lead

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time (On-site)

Job Purpose
     

            
    




	The Community Lead will provide strategic direction and oversight for the GATEWAY Program’s community management efforts across multiple states in Nigeria.
	The role will focus on creating and sustaining a thriving community ecosystem that enables marginalized youth, women, and vulnerable groups to engage actively, access resources, and transition into meaningful learning and work opportunities.
	The Community Lead will design and implement the overall community engagement strategy, build strong linkages with hubs, gig platforms, and ecosystem partners, and ensure the program’s communities are inclusive, accessible, and impactful.
	The Lead will manage and mentor Community Managers and Learning Community Coordinators, ensuring consistency, innovation, and quality in delivery across all states.


Key Responsibilities
Strategic Community Building and Engagement:


	Design and oversee the implementation of the GATEWAY Program’s community management strategy across hubs, digital platforms, and physical engagement spaces.
	Cultivate vibrant, inclusive communities that foster belonging, collaboration, and peer-to-peer learning.
	Oversee both online and offline engagement models, ensuring consistency, scalability, and innovation across states.
	Provide strategic direction for community-led events, peer-learning forums, and engagement campaigns, ensuring alignment with program objectives.


Participant Support and Pathways:


	Ensure participants have access to timely, effective support through well-coordinated escalation systems.
	Strengthen pathways linking participants to training, gig platforms, financial services, and mentorship opportunities.
	Provide leadership to resolve systemic participant challenges by analyzing recurring issues and coordinating program-level improvements.


Ecosystem Partnerships and Stakeholder Engagement


	Represent the community function in high-level stakeholder forums, ensuring participant voices shape program strategy and delivery.
	Drive collaboration with local organizations to deepen grassroots reach and inclusion.


Monitoring, Learning, and Reporting:


	Establish frameworks for measuring community growth, engagement, inclusivity, and impact across states.
	Guide the collection and analysis of participant feedback to inform continuous improvement.
	Ensure success stories, case studies, and community insights are systematically documented and shared with program leadership and donors.


Leadership, Mentorship, and Inclusion:


	Lead, mentor, and build the capacity of Community Managers and Learning Community Coordinators to deliver consistently across all states.
	Promote equity and accessibility in community initiatives, ensuring marginalized groups (young women, PWDs, displaced youth) are effectively reached.
	Model inclusive leadership and build a culture of trust, accountability, and continuous learning within the community team.


Key Performance Indicators


	Strategic Community Building and Engagement
	Participant Support and Pathways
	Ecosystem Partnerships and Stakeholder Engagement
	Monitoring, Learning, and Reporting
	Leadership, Mentorship, and Inclusion


Qualifications
Education:


	
	Bachelor’s degree in Social Sciences, Communications, Community Development, or a related field (Master’s preferred).
	


Experience:


	8–10 years of progressive experience in community leadership, youth mobilization, or large-scale engagement programs.
	Proven experience designing and implementing multi-state or multi-country community strategies.
	Track record of managing senior community managers, engagement officers, or volunteers.
	Demonstrated experience working with marginalized populations, particularly youth and women, and building inclusive ecosystems.


Skills and Competencies:


	Strong leadership and people management skills with experience coaching and mentoring teams.
	Advanced strategic planning and execution skills in community development.
	Excellent interpersonal, negotiation, and stakeholder management abilities.
	Strong understanding of digital engagement tools, social platforms, and community analytics.
	Ability to design inclusive, scalable, and data-driven community engagement models.
	Skilled in conflict resolution, trust-building, and ecosystem partnership development.
	Analytical mindset with the ability to translate data into actionable insights for program improvement.


Note


	Please note this is an onsite role in Lagos, Nigeria
	Co-creation HUB (CcHUB) is an equal opportunity employer.
	The Company prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type and affords equal employment opportunities to employees and applicants without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, pregnancy, age, national origin, disability status, genetic information, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
	The Company conforms to the spirit as well as to the letter of all applicable laws and regulations.

  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Engineering Manager",
  "description": "Olam Agri is a market-leading, differentiated food, feed, and fiber agri-business with a global origination footprint, processing capabilities, and deep understanding of market needs built over 33 years. With a strong presence in high-growth emerging markets and products across grains &amp; oilseeds, animal feed &amp; protein, rice, edible oils, specialty grains &amp; seeds, cotton, wood products, rubber and commodity financial services.

Olam Agri is at the heart of global food and agri-trade flows with more than 40 million MT in volume traded annually. Focused on transforming food, feed and fiber for a more sustainable future, it aims at creating value for customers, enabling farming communities to prosper sustainably, and strive for a food-secure future.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Engineering Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Kaduna

Job Description


	The&nbsp;Engineering Manager&nbsp;will be the driving force behind engineering excellence and maintenance operations within the factory.
	This role requires a proactive leader with extensive engineering experience, proven supervisory skills, and a strong commitment to safety and operational efficiency.
	You will be responsible for overseeing all factory processes, managing spare parts inventory, and ensuring maximum equipment uptime.
	Exceptional foresight, communication skills, and risk management capabilities are essential.
	Candidates should demonstrate technical expertise, leadership ability, and an appreciation for the complexities of the industry.


Key Deliverables


	Coordinate maintenance team schedules based on requests from safety, environmental, production, and other departments.
	Assign responsibilities to ensure proper maintenance of machinery, equipment, and utilities, supporting QMS, food safety, and occupational health standards.
	Conduct workplace risk assessments and ensure the&nbsp;LOTO (Lockout/Tagout)&nbsp;system is implemented, executed, and documented.
	Initiate, implement, and manage a plant maintenance program based on industry best practices, emphasizing planning, scheduling, and preventive/predictive maintenance.
	Collaborate with the&nbsp;MATS department&nbsp;to adopt global practices in the Sesame Hulling Factory, Sagamu.
	Track and analyze&nbsp;MTTR (Mean Time to Repair)&nbsp;and&nbsp;MTBF (Mean Time Between Failures)&nbsp;for process centers and utility sections.
	Maintain documentation for all maintenance tasks, repairs, and upgrades, including device lists, machine criticality assessments, condition appraisals, and drawing updates.
	Conduct performance evaluations and appraisals for maintenance personnel.
	Develop training calendars and provide skill-building exercises for the maintenance team.
	Ensure 100% compliance with safety permit systems and LOTO protocols.


Strategic Effectiveness:


	Develop and implement a comprehensive engineering plan for the factory.
	Establish preventive and corrective maintenance systems to maximize equipment uptime.
	Prepare and manage&nbsp;R&amp;M budgets&nbsp;and&nbsp;CAPEX proposals.
	Create daily, weekly, and monthly engineering reports to monitor operations and plant health.
	Maintain equipment history cards and plan upgrades or replacements.
	Generate technical drawings for modifications and improvements to enhance efficiency.


Operational Effectiveness:


	Monitor daily energy usage and downtime; maintain utilization reports.
	Build and lead diverse, high-performing teams.
	Demonstrate hands-on technical skills and train junior staff in equipment repair.
	Monitor packaging machinery for technical efficiency.
	Build vendor relationships for timely service and spare parts procurement, ensuring cost, quality, and time efficiency.
	Implement safety policies and foster a strong safety culture.
	Liaise with government agencies on environmental matters and advocate for health and safety.
	Identify training needs and deliver internal/on-the-job training; develop relevant training modules.
	Manage contracts in collaboration with legal and finance teams for timely execution.


Organizational Effectiveness:


	Maintain high&nbsp;OEE (Overall Equipment Effectiveness)&nbsp;across the plant.
	Conduct downtime analysis and optimize maintenance processes for resource efficiency.
	Manage spare parts inventory with a cost-effective system and build a network of&nbsp;JIT (Just-In-Time)&nbsp;suppliers.
	Lead process optimization and quality improvement initiatives.
	Ensure proper maintenance of&nbsp;LT/HT electrical installations.
	Monitor daily operations of&nbsp;generators, boilers, chillers, air compressors, WTP (Water Treatment Plant), and ETP (Effluent Treatment Plant)&nbsp;for energy-efficient performance.


Requirements


	Certified Engineer with a&nbsp;Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Mechanical Engineering.
	Minimum of&nbsp;10 years of experience in the FMCG industry.
	Strong knowledge of&nbsp;food safety&nbsp;and&nbsp;Quality Management Systems (QMS).
	Extensive experience in&nbsp;utilities and water treatment systems.

Engineering Manager Job at Olam Agri




        
    

        
        Olam Agri is a market-leading, differentiated food, feed, and fiber agri-business with a global origination footprint, processing capabilities, and deep understanding of market needs built over 33 years. With a strong presence in high-growth emerging markets and products across grains & oilseeds, animal feed & protein, rice, edible oils, specialty grains & seeds, cotton, wood products, rubber and commodity financial services.

Olam Agri is at the heart of global food and agri-trade flows with more than 40 million MT in volume traded annually. Focused on transforming food, feed and fiber for a more sustainable future, it aims at creating value for customers, enabling farming communities to prosper sustainably, and strive for a food-secure future.
     

            
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Engineering Manager

Job Location: Kaduna

Job Description


	The Engineering Manager will be the driving force behind engineering excellence and maintenance operations within the factory.
	This role requires a proactive leader with extensive engineering experience, proven supervisory skills, and a strong commitment to safety and operational efficiency.
	You will be responsible for overseeing all factory processes, managing spare parts inventory, and ensuring maximum equipment uptime.
	Exceptional foresight, communication skills, and risk management capabilities are essential.
	Candidates should demonstrate technical expertise, leadership ability, and an appreciation for the complexities of the industry.


Key Deliverables


	Coordinate maintenance team schedules based on requests from safety, environmental, production, and other departments.
	Assign responsibilities to ensure proper maintenance of machinery, equipment, and utilities, supporting QMS, food safety, and occupational health standards.
	Conduct workplace risk assessments and ensure the LOTO (Lockout/Tagout) system is implemented, executed, and documented.
	Initiate, implement, and manage a plant maintenance program based on industry best practices, emphasizing planning, scheduling, and preventive/predictive maintenance.
	Collaborate with the MATS department to adopt global practices in the Sesame Hulling Factory, Sagamu.
	Track and analyze MTTR (Mean Time to Repair) and MTBF (Mean Time Between Failures) for process centers and utility sections.
	Maintain documentation for all maintenance tasks, repairs, and upgrades, including device lists, machine criticality assessments, condition appraisals, and drawing updates.
	Conduct performance evaluations and appraisals for maintenance personnel.
	Develop training calendars and provide skill-building exercises for the maintenance team.
	Ensure 100% compliance with safety permit systems and LOTO protocols.


Strategic Effectiveness:


	Develop and implement a comprehensive engineering plan for the factory.
	Establish preventive and corrective maintenance systems to maximize equipment uptime.
	Prepare and manage R&M budgets and CAPEX proposals.
	Create daily, weekly, and monthly engineering reports to monitor operations and plant health.
	Maintain equipment history cards and plan upgrades or replacements.
	Generate technical drawings for modifications and improvements to enhance efficiency.


Operational Effectiveness:


	Monitor daily energy usage and downtime; maintain utilization reports.
	Build and lead diverse, high-performing teams.
	Demonstrate hands-on technical skills and train junior staff in equipment repair.
	Monitor packaging machinery for technical efficiency.
	Build vendor relationships for timely service and spare parts procurement, ensuring cost, quality, and time efficiency.
	Implement safety policies and foster a strong safety culture.
	Liaise with government agencies on environmental matters and advocate for health and safety.
	Identify training needs and deliver internal/on-the-job training; develop relevant training modules.
	Manage contracts in collaboration with legal and finance teams for timely execution.


Organizational Effectiveness:


	Maintain high OEE (Overall Equipment Effectiveness) across the plant.
	Conduct downtime analysis and optimize maintenance processes for resource efficiency.
	Manage spare parts inventory with a cost-effective system and build a network of JIT (Just-In-Time) suppliers.
	Lead process optimization and quality improvement initiatives.
	Ensure proper maintenance of LT/HT electrical installations.
	Monitor daily operations of generators, boilers, chillers, air compressors, WTP (Water Treatment Plant), and ETP (Effluent Treatment Plant) for energy-efficient performance.


Requirements


	Certified Engineer with a Bachelor’s degree in Mechanical Engineering.
	Minimum of 10 years of experience in the FMCG industry.
	Strong knowledge of food safety and Quality Management Systems (QMS).
	Extensive experience in utilities and water treatment systems.
